alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Dukes; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Nantucket; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 15 at 3:20PM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (3.8 to 13.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Eastern Essex MA, Suffolk MA, Eastern Norfolk MA, Eastern Plymouth MA, Barnstable MA, Dukes MA and Nantucket MA Counties. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Coastal flooding is expected along the North Shore from Gloucester to Newburyport. Wave action will likely cause some washover onto coastal roads around the time of high tide. Minor coastal flooding begins on Easy Street in Nantucket. Minor coastal flooding occurs along Morrissey Boulevard in Boston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...the highest probability of moderate coastal flooding is across the Cape Ann to the MA/NH border, including Plum Island. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
